reviews.review_msg:
He's a very interesting/passionate guy, but his lectures weren't helpful and I preferred to just study at home.

He doesn't upload assignment solutions online, which is a pretty big downside.

Assignments and tests are difficult, but normally they're either curved or only evaluated based on the easier questions. I didn't find this class tough.

Don't take this course if you don't need to. Not for human. All course materials are not making sense. If the course wasn't taken with DeVos, must have whole class failed. He will curve! He is a great prof. Hope he teaches all upper level math.
Really good at explaining tough concepts. He has excellent notes, but sometimes does proofs differently in class, so just be aware. If you have a chance to take a graph theory class with him, do it!

Hard course but very nice prof. He's obviously passionate about this course. I could not attend his lecture because of the conflict of another mandatory course that was not offered frequently. Assignments are difficult. I got tons of help from his office hours. I could not have survived this course otherwise.
He is a great prof. Definitely take this class with him if you can.
I think he is a good guy, just not a good prof. We didn't get grades for literally anything until almost 2 weeks after the final.
run. no marks given back the entire semester.

Awful prof. Super scatterbrained, and keeps jumping around in his notes so there's no logical flow. Difficult to follow his proof techniques. He seems knowledgeable in the material but is unable to convey it. Attending his office hours was useless as he was no help. Exams were difficult. Killed any interest I initially had in the subject. AVOID.
